intro: Tanacetum odessanum, commonly known as the Odessa tansy, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, gray-green leaves with a strongly aromatic scent. Its yellow flower heads consist of ray florets surrounding a central disc, blooming in late summer. Tanacetum odessanum is often used in ornamental gardening for its ornate appearance and medicinal properties.
